alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 9:57AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Douglas and Franklin. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 956 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ottawa, Baldwin City, Wellsville, Centropolis, Pomona, Richmond, Lone Star, Princeton, Lane, Rantoul, Pleasant Grove, Globe and Vinland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
